If you want that flavor of toastedÂ 
marshmallows but you don't have a fire goingÂ Â

i've come up with a muchÂ 
easier method for you to use.Â Â

Put some non-stick baking paper on a sandwichÂ 
press spray it very lightly with cooking oilÂ Â

and add your marshmallows then let them meltÂ 
until they look nice and golden on the bottomÂ Â

then move that baking paper onto a cold piece ofÂ 
stone or a block of ice will do to rapidly cool itÂ Â

so we can pick it up off the paper.
Looks like an egg minus the yolk.Â

Next there is a new player bursting into theÂ

Kawaii Cake Storytime, Cake Story, Spirit CakeÂ

and don't be fooled by the thumbnails. This videoÂ

freak shakes and no this one doesn't even mentionÂ Â

a giant car cake and this one is not about aÂ 
giant dress cake. The cakes in the thumbnailÂ Â

are pure clickbait. I've raised this issue withÂ

thumbnail's not matching what the content is andÂ 
surely that violates one of youtube's policies theÂ Â

thumbnail policy here where it says misleadingÂ 
viewers into thinking they're about to viewÂ Â

something that's not in the video but the responseÂ 
from the policy team from YouTube was that it's onÂ Â

the same topic so it's still cake so it's notÂ 
really that misleading it's okay. So i'm reallyÂ Â

glad that YouTube doesn't sell actual productsÂ 
because can you imagine if you ordered a life-sizeÂ Â

3D car cake and then you got this cake and if youÂ 
complained they would say well you ordered a cakeÂ Â

and you got a cake so it wasn't misleading at all
ğŸ˜. I think we have different understandings ofÂ Â

what misleading is but anyway the reason i boughtÂ 
these channels to your attention was not theÂ Â

thumbnails, it was actually a totally differentÂ 
reason ... if parents are letting their kids watchÂ Â

these channels and they have headphones on theyÂ 
might think that they're just watching videos thatÂ Â

are decorating videos to music but in realityÂ 
you're letting Life Studio make up stories andÂ Â

tell them to your kids. I want to tell you howÂ 
i was held hostage by a crazy guy and i justÂ Â

couldn't get away ... i'm going to tell youÂ 
a really crazy story of how a student of mineÂ Â

tried to make a move on me ... andÂ 
while some of them are very unrealisticÂ Â

like a girl on her way to school they drop intoÂ 
the shops she accidentally knocks a gun out of aÂ Â

robber's hand who turns out to be a wanted serialÂ 
killer who's escaped from jail ... give me my gunÂ Â

the robber screamed and lunged at me my heart wasÂ 
pounding so hard in my chest as i dodged him. IÂ Â

then aimed the gun towards him in an awkward wayÂ 
he raised both of his hands up and surrenderedÂ Â

it was a fantastic experience but the thought ofÂ 
being late in my first class was distracting me.Â

Yeah i'm pretty sure after that experience youÂ 
don't just worry about getting to school on timeÂ Â

you'd probably have the day off and most peopleÂ 
don't describe being held up at gunpoint as aÂ Â

fantastic experience but anyway i assume they'reÂ 
just supposed to be kids stories and not realisticÂ Â

at all but then again they're not really stories iÂ 
would want kids to listen to. Most of the storiesÂ Â

it is a school-aged child usually a girl whoÂ 
is the main character in the story but they'reÂ Â

usually from a neglectful or abusive home life.Â 
She looked at me with burning eyes and she startedÂ Â

approaching me with the chair still in her handsÂ 
i immediately hid in my closet right before my momÂ Â

took the last swing that was meant for me but itÂ 
hit the ground and the chair broke apart. In otherÂ Â

ones both the parents die in car accidents andÂ 
in still others the dad is really angry with aÂ Â

girl's boyfriend for stealing some of her money soÂ 
this is his response ... my dad pulled him insideÂ Â

and threw him on the couch. Valery go upstairsÂ 
and get your swimsuits he said i did as he askedÂ Â

my dad then forced Aiden to wear them and tookÂ 
many pictures. He forced Aiden to upload themÂ Â

to his own instagram page! I don't know whatÂ 
the laws are in Vietnam but here in AustraliaÂ Â

if an adult did that to a child you'd be up onÂ 
criminal charges. That's just creepy! And if yourÂ Â

kids have been watching these channels you mightÂ 
need to re-educate them about stranger danger.Â

Someone knocked on the front door i opened itÂ 
and saw a strange tiny man standing there withÂ Â

a creepy smile on his face and he smells reallyÂ 
good he said hi i'm Noah i'm looking for your dadÂ Â

is he home i replied no he's out there lookingÂ 
for a stupid job. I was about to close the doorÂ Â

in his face when he suddenly pushed it back openÂ 
i screamed i thought he was going to hurt me heÂ Â

took off his glasses and told me to stay calm heÂ 
looked a lot less intimidating without his glassesÂ Â

on and his face was softer i said okay come on in.
For any kids watching if you do happen to be homeÂ Â

alone do not answer the door at all and if youÂ 
did you would never let a stranger in to your homeÂ Â

that is not a good idea and despite what you hearÂ 
in this next story you should never ever meet upÂ Â

with someone who you have met in an online forum.
After one of my live youtube videos one of myÂ Â

viewers sent a message asking if we could meet itÂ 
was a bit strange for someone to be so insistentÂ Â

especially after what my brother was doing soÂ 
i ignored him at first then a few days later heÂ Â

messaged me again he said he knew how to deal withÂ 
my brother he believed me i agreed to meet him butÂ Â

i was nervous what if it's just a stupid prank iÂ 
wondered i went to the coffee shop he had askedÂ Â

me to go to i didn't even know his name. And inÂ 
that story he turns out to be a handsome knightÂ Â

in shining armour who rescues her from all herÂ 
troubled home life problems. That is not how thatÂ Â

story normally ends if someone is pressuring youÂ 
and wants to meet you you need to tell a trustedÂ Â

adult if you can't tell your parents find anotherÂ 
trusted adult in your life to tell about thatÂ Â

do not ever meet someone from online on yourÂ 
own, not safe not okay! ğŸˆ So cakes have gone fromÂ Â

how to videos where people explain how to makeÂ 
a cake to fast-forwarded videos to music now toÂ Â

the top! I cannot predict what will be next onÂ Â

this platform it is a bit crazy. This next one wasÂ

and the bubbles in weak acid in the drinkÂ

Dawn detergent don't put a lot that's people messÂ Â

a little bit hazy that means the chicken is nowÂ Â

clean. Then you're gonna rinse it right here myÂ

Where do i start with that one there was so muchÂ 
wrong with it let's begin with letting the chickenÂ Â

fall down the garbage disposal unit and thenÂ 
pulling it out! How many germs are you going toÂ Â

get on it from doing that that's just oh not good,Â 
secondly using bleach on your food to clean it noÂ Â

bleach is not supposed to be ingestedÂ 
bleach is an irritant to your mouth andÂ Â

your gastrointestinal tract and your skin thatÂ 
should not be used on your food please don'tÂ Â

copy that, not a good idea. Now where does thatÂ 
come from most people are washing their chickenÂ Â

and going to the extremes of using things likeÂ 
bleach because they think they need to kill theÂ Â

bacteria on the chicken but the thing that killsÂ 
the bacteria on the chicken is not washing itÂ Â

it's cooking it. So you have to cook your chickenÂ 
really well and that will take care of all theÂ Â

bacteria that will kill the bacteria even washingÂ 
it with bleach is not going to kill the bacteriaÂ Â

bleach needs to be in contact with the bacteriaÂ 
for 10 minutes before it's going to be effective.Â Â

So research has actually shown that people whoÂ 
wash their chicken in their sink are actuallyÂ Â

more likely to get food poisoning because they'reÂ 
spreading bacteria all around their kitchen whichÂ Â

this video illustrates beautifully. If we watchÂ 
it again you can see this still has bacteria on itÂ Â

now her gloves have bacteria on it and she touchesÂ 
the detergent bottle so that's now contaminatedÂ Â

then she touches the tap so that also hasÂ 
bacteria on it and now the top of the spiceÂ Â

bottle and all the other spices too and of courseÂ 
the sink itself has bacteria on it too. With thatÂ Â

level of contamination all over your kitchenÂ 
it's very easy then for bacteria to get ontoÂ Â

food that's not going to be baked like a saladÂ 
or something else that you could ingest whichÂ Â

could give you food poisoning and make you sick.Â 
So make sure when you cook your chicken you bakeÂ Â

it really well to kill all the bacteria and tryÂ 
not to spread the bacteria all over your kitchenÂ Â

before you get it into the oven or the fry pan.
From there on to the headlines that say FacebookÂ Â

gave the angry emoji five times the value ofÂ 
a like. Now while that headline is actuallyÂ Â

true it's kind of deceptive because at the timeÂ 
when facebook introduced all the different emojisÂ Â

that you could respond to posts with they gaveÂ 
all the emojis the value of five times a like,Â Â

so that wasn't so much an issue what the issueÂ 
was that after a year or so the data scientistsÂ Â

started to note a pattern which was the ğŸ˜  theÂ 
ğŸ˜² and the ğŸ˜‚ emojis when they were used a lot onÂ Â

posts those posts seemed to be the ones thatÂ 
contained a lot of misinformation or hatefulÂ Â

content and basically bad posts for people toÂ 
be exposed to. When they knew that informationÂ Â

they didn't demote the power of those emojis whichÂ 
would have meant those posts weren't seen as much,Â Â

they just kept it how it was! They have doneÂ 
so now apparently but they've demoted theÂ Â

power of all the emojis. Facebook as wellÂ 
as most businesses will do experiments andÂ Â

run experiments to see what is going to work forÂ 
them what is going to make the most profit what isÂ Â

going to be best but because Facebook hasÂ 
access to so much of your data and so muchÂ Â

of your interactions you might be surprisedÂ 
at how personal some of these experiments get.Â Â

For example they did one experiment testingÂ 
what if we show you all negative postsÂ Â

in your feed versus if we show you all positiveÂ 
posts in your feed and we do that for a whole weekÂ Â

after the week the posts that you then writeÂ 
yourself are they going to be mainly negativeÂ Â

or are they going to be mainly positive? AndÂ 
they found that in fact it was true they couldÂ Â

manipulate your emotions ... if they showed youÂ 
positive things you wrote positive posts if theyÂ Â

showed you mainly negative things after a weekÂ 
you were writing negative posts! InterestinglyÂ Â

most of these sort of studies or psychologicalÂ 
studies would be carried out by a universityÂ Â

and universities have very strict rules wheneverÂ 
you're doing human studies including psychologicalÂ Â

ones The volunteers have to give their consentÂ 
to be part of it and they have to have informedÂ Â

consent they need to know the positives andÂ 
the negatives of being part of the study,Â Â

they need to be able to pull out at any timeÂ 
and they should be debriefed at the end of theÂ Â

study to make sure there's no harm caused toÂ 
the volunteers. But in this case Facebook isÂ Â

not a university they're a private company so theyÂ 
are not bound by any of those rules and in theirÂ Â

terms and conditions which you agreed to when youÂ 
made a Facebook account it says here we use theÂ Â

information that we have including from researchÂ 
partners that we collaborate with to conductÂ Â

and support research and innovation on topics ofÂ 
general social welfare, technological advancement,Â Â

public interest health and well-being and theÂ 
interesting thing again is most universities willÂ Â

do these studies in order to find out what is goodÂ 
for people and then people use that research toÂ Â

change policies and do things which are going toÂ 
make things better for people but in this case theÂ Â

main aim is not to do better by you but to doÂ 
better by the shareholders ğŸ¤‘ During my time atÂ Â

Facebook first working as the lead product managerÂ 
for civic misinformation and later on counterÂ Â

espionage i saw Facebook repeatedly encounterÂ 
conflicts between its own profits and our safety.Â Â

Facebook consistently resolved these conflicts inÂ 
favour of its own profits! We need some sort ofÂ Â

rules or regulation in these sort of forumsÂ 
to make sure that things that cause harm toÂ Â

people shouldn't be allowed and we understand theÂ 
difficulty there of only the people within theÂ Â

company have this information so they can justÂ 
keep it all secret and we don't even know thatÂ Â

they know that it's causing harm and that they'reÂ 
making decisions over that so very interestingÂ Â

topic if you want to look into that more youÂ
